explanation:
code_hardening: Added null and empty checks for the input query string and individual pairs, handled missing '=' defensively, used generics diamond operator, and applied final modifiers to locals where appropriate.
resolve_compilation_errors: Updated the API to a single method that accepts only a query string and returns Map<String, List<String>> to support multiple values per key; no external callers are referenced within this function.
exception_handling: Preserved UnsupportedEncodingException in the method signature and ensured both full-query decoding and per-key/value decoding are covered consistently.
logic_customization: Removed all URL and '?' splitting logic, always processed the provided query string, decoded the entire query string first (UTF-8), then split on '&' and '=', decoded keys and values, and aggregated multiple values per key.
refactoring: Renamed the method to parseQueryString to reflect its responsibility and clarified the parameter name to indicate it expects only a query component.
misc: Updated inline comments to document the new behavior; no new custom API calls were introduced beyond existing JDK classes.
